volumeInfo.subtitle: A Computational Perspective
volumeInfo.description: In the new edition of this highly successful book, Richard Crandall and Carl Pomerance provide updated material on theoretical, computational, and algorithmic fronts. The authors also list many new computational records and survey new developments in the theory of prime numbers.About the first edition:"It's rare to say this of a math book, but open Prime Numbers to a random page and it's hard to put down. Crandall and Pomerance have written a terrific book." - BULLETIN OF THE AMS
volumeInfo.title: Prime Numbers

searchInfo.textSnippet: From the reviews of the first edition: "Destined to become a definitive textbook conveying the most modern computational ideas about prime numbers and factoring, this book will stand as an excellent reference for this kind of computation, ...
